metadata.Title: CVE-2021-25214 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In BIND 9.8.5 -> 9.8.8, 9.9.3 -> 9.11.29, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.13, and versionsBIND 9.9.3-S1 -> 9.11.29-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -> 9.16.13-S1 of BIND 9 SupportedPreview Edition, as well as release versions 9.17.0 -> 9.17.11 of the BIND9.17 development branch, when a vulnerable version of named receives amalformed IXFR triggering the flaw described above, the named process willterminate due to a failed assertion the next time the transferred secondaryzone is refreshed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-25214` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.8
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.8
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.8
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.8
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.8
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.8
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.8').
